org.itemscript.core.values
Class ItemscriptItem

java.lang.Object
  org.itemscript.core.values.ItemscriptItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
HasSystem, JsonGetAccess, JsonItem, JsonPutAccess
public final class ItemscriptItem
extends java.lang.Object
implements JsonItem

The implementation class for JsonItem.

Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

addHandler

public HandlerReg addHandler(Handler handler)
Description copied from interface: JsonItem
Add an event handler to this item. The handler will be called any time the value of this item changes or is removed. The returned HandlerReg can be used to remove the event handler at a later date.

Specified by:
addHandler in interface JsonItem
Parameters:
handler - The Handler to attach to this JsonItem.
Returns:
The HandlerReg for this event handler.

get

public JsonValue get(java.lang.String url)
Description copied from interface: JsonItem
Get a value from (or relative to) this item by URL. If the URL is a fragment only (starting with "#"), the fragment will be used to retrieve a value from the root value of this item. A fragment of "#" will return the root value; a fragment containing a string will be split on the dot (".") character, and each component will be URL-unencoded, then the components will be used to navigate from the root value of this item to the desired child item. If the URL is a relative URL (starting with a path or a query), it will be interpreted as relative to the source URL of this item and then retrieved with JsonSystem.get(String). If the URL is an absolute URL, it will be retrieved with JsonSystem.get(String).

Specified by:
get in interface JsonItem
Parameters:
url - The URL to get.
Returns:
The value returned by the get operation.

get

public void get(java.lang.String url,
                GetCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: JsonItem
Get a value from (or relative to) this item by URL, asynchronously. The URL will be interpreted the same way as in JsonItem.get(String). The supplied callback will be called when the value is returned.

Specified by:
get in interface JsonItem
Parameters:
url - The URL to get.
callback - The callback that will be called when the get operation completes.

getBinary in interface JsonGetAccess
Parameters:

Returns:
The binary value, or null if it it did not exist or was not a JsonString.

getValue

public JsonValue getValue(java.lang.String url)
Description copied from interface: JsonGetAccess
Get a JsonValue. If the value does not exist, returns null.

This method is named "getValue" to avoid conflicts with the List and Map "get" methods. A method named "get" will be provided by any class implementing this interface, and that method should be used instead of this one, for brevity.

Specified by:
getValue in interface JsonGetAccess
Parameters:
url - The key used to find the value.
Returns:
The value, or null if the value did not exist.

public void notifyPut(java.lang.String fragment)

Parameters:
fragment - The fragment of the value that has been put; "#" if we put a new value for this item.

Parameters:

put

public PutResponse put(java.lang.String url,
                       byte[] value)
Description copied from interface: JsonPutAccess
Put a binary value. The value will be base64-encoded and stored in a JsonString.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Specified by:
put in interface JsonPutAccess
Parameters:
url - The URL to put the value under.
value - The binary value to store.
Returns:
The PutResponse returned by the put operation.

putValue

public PutResponse putValue(java.lang.String url,
                            JsonValue value)
Description copied from interface: JsonPutAccess
Put a JsonValue.

Note that the return from this method is the value that was returned from the put operation, which differs from the Map.put(K, V) method which returns any previous value that the map had under that url.

The put methods on JsonSystem and JsonItem are interchangeable with this method.

Specified by:
putValue in interface JsonPutAccess
Parameters:
url - The URL to put the value under.
value - The JsonValue to store.
Returns:
The PutResponse returned by the put operation.

removeHandler

public void removeHandler(HandlerReg reg)
Description copied from interface: JsonItem
Remove an event handler from this item. Use this to clean up event handlers when the object they point to needs to be garbage-collected; otherwise, they will leak memory.

Specified by:
removeHandler in interface JsonItem
Parameters:
reg - The original HandlerReg that was returned from addHandler.

removeValue

public RemoveResponse removeValue(java.lang.String url)
Description copied from interface: JsonPutAccess
Remove a value.

This method is named "removeValue" to avoid conflicts with the List and Map "remove" methods. A method named "remove" will be provided by any class implementing this interface, and that method should be used instead of this one, for brevity.

Specified by:
removeValue in interface JsonPutAccess
Parameters:
url - The URL indicating the value to remove.
Returns:
The RemoveResponse returned by the remove operation.
